alert.note: Alert for Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 12:37PM EST until December 20 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Hampshire...Maine... Saco River At Conway affecting Oxford, Cumberland and Carroll Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saco River at Conway. * WHEN...From this morning to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding occurs on West Side Road in two sections, cutting off access to hundreds of homes. River Road flooded on the west bank impacting agricultural lands. Floodwaters inundate first floors of properties in Transvale Acres. At 14.0 feet, Widespread flooding occurs along the west bank of the Saco River near Moat Brook Road, cutting off access to some homes. Flood waters enter agricultural lands in eastern Conway and into Freyburg. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM EST Monday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:45 AM EST Monday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
